messageBody:
Hi,
(Also cross-posted to the TestNG list - apologies if you get this twice)

I am trying to evaluate JUnit 4and TestNG.

I have built classes that use the backwards compatibility of each of
the newer test frameworks to enable the reuse of existing JUnit 3.8
style test helper classes, (these exercise
equals/hashcode/serializable/comparable and accessors and come from
the Junit addons project and the TestUtil project).

Although each testcase works, I'm not entirely happy I am 'doing it right'.

For example the JUnit 4 code is not working as I expected when I used
the @RunWith(Enclosed.class)
annotation - it only picks up the enclosed classes, not the public
'outer' class.

Also, the TestNG code must implement TestCase because the non-public
classes are JUnit 3.8 style, and setting the compatibility option
seems to preclude using TestNG style tests in the public class.

To illustrate I have a toy class under test, (Person), and a testcase
for this implemented in each framework. I've posted this code up here:
http://javaunittest.pbwiki.com/
for discussion and correction by anyone and everyone.

Would members of the list mind having a look over the code and
suggesting improvements?

Many Thanks!
Chris
